http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...-from-politics/The StarFriday, 3 March 2017Tee Keat retires from politicsPETALING JAYA: Former MCA president Tan Sri Ong Tee Keat has called it quits in politics after more than 30 years in the scene, saying that he wants a life without partisan politics.He said he would not be joining any other party.Ong officially resigned from the party on Jan 2 in a letter addressed to MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai and the Registrar of Societies.“I left in the beginning of the year so that I can have a fresh start.“I just want to lead a life without partisan politics.“I’ve been busy with my writing, which is part of my hobby,” he said.Ong said that he was preparing to write his memoirs and was also into creative writing.Furthermore, he said he was occupied with his newly-founded The Malaysia China Silk Road Business Chamber and cultural involvement through engagements with China, Taiwan and other parts of the world.MCA Youth chief Datuk Chong Sin Woon said he felt a little sad as Ong was the one who “showed him the way” into MCA.“I wish him all the best and good luck,” he said.Ong was MCA president from November 2008 to March 2010 but failed to defend his post in the 2010 party polls where he lost to Tan Sri Dr Chua Soi Lek.He was also dropped as the Transport Minister in June 2010 in a Cabinet reshuffle by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak.
